Reviews.Content: Best Kept Secret in Florence I went to Florence with my mother this past may and really loved Residenza Giulia. A very quick (10 min) bus ride to the center of town (or a 20-30 minute walk). The bus drops you off right in front of the hotel. The room was large, clean, and very pleasant with a great view from the balcony. Anna was extremely helpful and super nice. Some decent neighborhood restaurants around the Residenza as well. Overall wonderful stay at a very reasonable price. Honestly, it was great to be somewhere convenient to the center of town that wasn't in the middle of tourist central.
Reviews.Author: lauritica

Reviews.Content: A little gem My husband and I booked a room here as we don't spend alot of time in our hotels when we're away and just wanted somewhere simple to return to at night. We were pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome that we received and the help that Anna and David gave us in locating good restaurants and telling us where to catch buses etc. There are a few supermarkets over the road (past the 'New Gate') so if you fancy taking some fruit juice or food back to the room it's easy to do. The BB is only about 10 minutes walk away from the railway station - you hit a nice little cafe (La Gatta e Le Volpe) on the way down to it that serves lovely espresso.........and the River Arno and sights are within easy walking distance.If you want somewhere at a very reasonable rate (for Florence), which is clean and comfortable with helpful management, look no further.
Reviews.Author: Scubatwo

Reviews.Content: Great B+B, though quite far from centre We really enjoyed staying in this B+B. The room itself was very quiet, very clean and we felt like we had the whole place to ourselves. There is also a lovely balcony to sit out on, although the road below is noisy. Bear in mind that this B+B is about 20 minutes walk from the main sights in Florence. There is a bus, but we didn't try it out. It would have been a good idea in hindsight though, as we found the walk back a bit tiring.
Reviews.Author: Emily78

Reviews.Content: The Residenza Giulia Florence - A Nice Bed and Breakfast Italy and Florence is not famous for it's high standards of Bed and Breakfasts but myself and my husband had a wonderful time at this Bed and Breakfast. Located on the top floor of an Italian residential block the Residenza Giulia is run by a retired Florentine couple who could not be nicer when it comes to helping you with your sightseeing activities. We booked online direct with the Bed and Breakfast (i don't remember the name of their website) - the rates are very competitive as we shopped around a lot before opting for the Residenza Giulia Bed and Breakfast in Florence. The only slight drawback is that you are a 15 minute walk from the Duomo and a 10 minute walk from the train station... not a lot I know but an important consideration if you are elderly. I look forward to my next visit to the Residenza Giulia.
Reviews.Author: ilovedeniro

Reviews.Content: Lovely! This is a nice bed-and-breakfast located in a large penthouse apartment, slightly out of the downtown core. My room had access to the terrace, with great views of the Tuscan hills and a part of Florence. I had a private bathroom as well, very new and clean. The room was large, clean and beautifully decorated. The place is run by an elderly gentleman and his son, they both speak decent English and are very kind. This is a quiet and pleasant place and a great option for your stay in Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Florence for 42.50 euro per person Our family enjoyed our stay at Residenza Giula. We had two rooms and were very comfortable and safe. The rooms/bahrooms are very clean, decorated nicely,comfortable beds, and we had a very quiet two evenings. QUIET! Parking available below for only 20 euro a nite.We walked to the main areas of Florence. A simple breakfast is in the room ready for you to enjoy. Make your coffee or tea when you want to and enjoy a crossant.The owners are so welcoming, helpful and nice. We enjoyed it being off the tourist path. Enjoy your stay in Florence and don't overlook this little gem.
Reviews.Author: back/from/italy

Reviews.Content: Lovely Bed and Breakfast I stayed here last month and had a great time. The special winter offer (stay 03 nights pay 02) was excellent value for money.... The weather was even so nice that we had breakfast on the terrace with a great view of Florence. The main attractions are all easily reachable and I would recommend this bed and breakfast to anyone!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
